org.midica.ui

Class UiController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.midica.ui.UiController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class UiController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener

    This class provides the controller of the main window.

    It listens and reacts to events in the UiView.

    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller

    • Method Detail

      • initView

        private void initView()

        Initializes the main window by creating the UiView object and all possible types of FileSelectors.

        This method is also called after changing the language in order to re-draw everything.

      • initSelectorsIfNotYetDone

        private void initSelectorsIfNotYetDone()

        Initializes all possible types of FileSelectors.

      • getView

        public UiView getView()

        Returns the view of the main window.

        Returns:
        main window view.

      • soundfontLoadedBySourceCode

        public void soundfontLoadedBySourceCode()

        Sets the soundfont file name label after loading a soundfont by MidicaPL source code.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)

        This method processes all action events in the UiView.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - The event to be handled.

      • itemStateChanged

        public void itemStateChanged(java.awt.event.ItemEvent e)

        Handles selecting/deselecting of one of the remember checkboxes.

        Specified by:
        itemStateChanged in interface java.awt.event.ItemListener
        Parameters:
        e - The event to be handled.

      • openExportFileSelector

        private void openExportFileSelector(java.lang.String cmd)

        Checks if a MIDI sequence is set and opens the file selector to choose the file to be exported.

        If no MIDI sequence is set, shows an error message instead of opening the file selector.

        Parameters:
        cmd - The action command of the pressed button.

      • parseChosenFile

        private void parseChosenFile(java.lang.String type,
                             java.io.File file)

        Parses the chosen file using the right parser for the right file type. A wait dialog is shown during the parsing. The parsing itself is executed by a SwingWorker.

        Parameters:
        type - File type.
        file - Selected file.

      • updateAfterPlayerClosed

        public void updateAfterPlayerClosed()

        Updates the parsed file label after the player has been closed. This is necessary because a reparse from the player could have failed. Then the label must not display the file name any more.

      • exportChosenFile

        private void exportChosenFile(java.lang.String type,
                              java.io.File file)

        Exports to the chosen file using the right exporter for this file type.

        Parameters:
        type - File type.
        file - Selected file.

      • showErrorMessage

        private void showErrorMessage(java.lang.String message)

        Opens an error message window showing the given message.

        Parameters:
        message - Error message.

      • showExportResult

        private void showExportResult(ExportResult result)

        Opens an export result window showing the given export result.

        Parameters:
        result - Export result containing warnings and errors of a file export.

      • displayFilename

        private void displayFilename(java.lang.String type,
                             java.lang.String filename)

        Displays the imported file name in the right field (according to the file type).

        Parameters:
        type - File type.
        filename - File name.

      • windowActivated

        public void windowActivated(java.awt.event.WindowEvent e)

        Initializes key bindings and refreshes the current transpose level that has been set in the player (or 0, if the transpose level has not yet been changed).

        Specified by:
        windowActivated in interface java.awt.event.WindowListener
        Parameters:
        e - Window event.

      • configurationChanged

        private void configurationChanged(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String selectedId)

        Applies configuration changes.

        This method is called whenever one of the configuration comboboxes is changed.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the combobox that has been changed.
        selectedId - ID of the selected item in the combobox.
